title: [bug] set_actionvation_policy() breaks window.show()

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

Making an app use the Accessory activation policy (`app.set_activation_policy(tauri::ActivationPolicy::Accessory);`) makes the `window.show()` method not work.

P.S. I wrote in the Discord forums and they asked me to log the issue here.

### Reproduction

main.rs:
```
fn main() {
    tauri::Builder::default()
        .setup(|app| {
            app.set_activation_policy(tauri::ActivationPolicy::Accessory);
            Ok(())
        })
        .invoke_handler(tauri::generate_handler![greet])
        .run(tauri::generate_context!())
        .expect("error while running tauri application");
}
```

tauric.conf.json:
```
"windows": [
  { "visible": false }
]
```

App.tsx (you can do it in global shortcut handler):
```
getCurrent().show();
```

### Expected behavior

The window to show.
